>The suspicious dialogue of the demon lady, basically, she implies that she's past her prime and that had it been 300 years ago, she would've fought him off full force, but apparently they weaken over time and are supposed to be succeeded by their offspring once their power is up to the standard of a lord/lady/king/queen.

>It all comes down to survival protocol, the demon lord/lady wins by being around, all those demons slain are cannon fodder, it won't stop until the "progenitor prime" is vanquished, demons value above all, power, the hero had enough of it to one-shot her strongest servant/son, that shit is hot as fuck to them, she instead entered procreation mode, demons have a knack for manipulation, subversion, domination and control, that's what a "queen" would be all about, she doesn't have to fight to win when her stats are about subtlety & tactical long term victory, original plan = demoralize hero, in case that fails, subvert hero, powerful, but vulnerable = the perfect prey.

Came back to this right back to give it a second read (something I rarely do) and... what if...:
>"Carlos" is really a demon send with the role/objective of infiltrating the hero's party and sowing distrust, unrest and ultimately make humanity's effort crumble and fail

>What "hero party" is only composed of 3? at minimum, it is usually 4, unless they die at the final stages of the journey, my guess is that there was another woman, but he took "care" of her before the healer girl

>The way they went about it, seems like the aim was to break the hero's resolve by having him plunder into despair through betrayal and feel like it's pointless to even try finishing the journey as the 3 of them were struggling, let alone 1. I genuinely expected the hero (from the title) to get ganked by himself and that would be the tragic end of it, what they didn't know is that mc's delusional spazzyness would grant him the power boost required to one-shot the demon lady's strongest unit.
I hope Queen Bee does not animate it

- countless times before, offers the mc a chance to be able to properly play the tragic game that is his life (up to the player/mc if he accepts it or not) and either gets crushed by the world's injustice by trying to make things "right" or "quits" and takes distance from it all dragging tons of turmoil & torment before ultimately succumbing to it, going mad and withering away in misery... or, take the offer, power up n grind like crazy, go from nobody to nightmare and become the thing the world is afraid of, pursue the path of revenge and seek vindication by delivering a "good" dose of retribution to those who wronged, betrayed, abandoned and even forgot you.
Personal gratification you'll feel was long owed to you and having learned that power = entitlement, well, it's time to play the game in a way that is described as "The Meta", because when it all comes down to it, you're either weak and doomed at other's "mercy" or you're powerfull enough to have the plot revolve around you.

Can't help but to come back to this one and believe that this doujin is one of the VERY rare few where the NTR loving army and the NTR hating army can band together as brothers and equally say that this is a masterpiece.

I mean, this basically cracks the code. How do you make (almost) everyone happy? How do you please both NTR and vanilla fans? Revenge. You just don't end the story with the MC being a sad-sack cuckold. You break them so that they can be forged anew, better and stronger. You have them come back and visit their wrath upon those who wrong them; and have them absolutely revel in it.
Welp, that fuckin' goes places alright.

This doujin is suprisingly good. I mean it. The art style, designs and background to the plot and the characters themselves. At first it felt like the hero had an incel mindset, thinking only he deserved Miria. However he was simply confused, full of envy and struck with determination to do the things that he thinks is right to do. The characters in a great scheme are all flawed, but their actions from a human perspective is understandable. Miria was horny and felt ignored. And the NTR Guy also just wanted to live for his own happiness. What sucked was the whole NTR thing itself. Don't cheat and just communicate the problem. People can't read minds. I think the hero could have looked past thi ngs and not felt cucked, if they simply would have been honest. However he felt betrayed and his pent up confusion and hurt feelings made him easily manipulated. Albeit the DL is right, the world ain't black and white. Damn, I actually wanted hust to fap, but the stort was too interesting.

As far as an NTR story goes, this was quite refreshing. With that said, Harry is also at fault that caused Miria to look for someone else. Yes, Miria isn't faultless, but Harry neglected his relationship her in favor of finishing the mission. For good reason ofc, but he FAILED to  COMMUNICATE this properly to Miria. You know, like, ACTUALLY tell her he loves her instead of keeping it in his head? Ofc this depends on what actually happened with Miria and Carlos' POV, but that's how it reads between the lines. Do remember that a relationship is a two-way street. If one side doesn't make an effort to meet the wants and needs of the other, then that connection will slowly break. Lastly, it doesn't even seem that Harry and Miria are in a romantic relationship. Mutual attraction and childhood friends, yes, but as boyfriend and girlfriend? The one time the word boyfriend came up, it came as sarcasm on Carlos' part, and the word girlfriend or couple never came up.
